intro: Xanthostemon whitei, commonly known as the white xanthostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters. Xanthostemon whitei is typically found in heathlands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting native wildlife.
